intro: Paracaryum calathicarpum, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub, with stems that often produce offsets.
